H0.text: It adds nutrients to the soil, thereby contributing to good soil.

H1.text: It helps the soil to dry out, which contributes to good soil when organic matter is present.

H2.text: It keeps the soil cool, thereby contributing to good soil through the presence of organic matter.

H3.text: It destroys bacteria in the soil is how the presence of organic matter contributes to good soil.

A4.text: SOM increases soil fertility by providing cation exchange sites and being a reserve of plant nutrients, especially nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), and sulfur (S).

A5.text: The microbial decomposers are included in the SOM and form a food web of organisms that prey upon each other and subsequently become prey.
